description: The 'clocks' function is designed to create a visual representation of an analog clock. It uses the matplotlib library to draw a circle representing the clock face, tick marks for hours and minutes, and hands for hours and minutes. The function uses mathematical concepts such as angles and radii to position the elements of the clock correctly. The educational purpose of this function is to help students understand the concept of time, the structure of an analog clock, and the mathematical principles behind it, such as angles and circular geometry.

parameters.name: stim
parameters.description: An instance of the Clock class that contains the time to be displayed on the analog clock.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Clocks
stimulus_type_specification.description: The images depict an analog clock with a specific time. The clock face is a circle with tick marks for each minute. Every fifth tick mark is larger, representing the hours. The clock also has an hour hand and a minute hand, which point to the current hour and minute, respectively.

details: The clock face is a circle with a radius of 1 unit.
There are 60 tick marks around the edge of the clock face, each representing one minute.
Every fifth tick mark is larger, representing the hours.
The hour hand is shorter and thicker, pointing to the current hour.
The minute hand is longer and thinner, pointing to the current minute.

stimulus_type_specification.educational_purpose: These images serve as educational tools to help students understand the concept of time and the structure of an analog clock. They also introduce students to the mathematical principles of angles and circular geometry.
